metadata.title: CVE-2023-52340 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel before 6.3 has anet/ipv6/route.c max_size threshold that can be consumed easily, e.g.,leading to a denial of service (network is unreachable errors) when IPv6packets are sent in a loop via a raw socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-175-generic - 5.4.0-175.195~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-175-lowlatency - 5.4.0-175.195~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1122-aws - 5.4.0-1122.132~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1127-azure - 5.4.0-1127.134~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1126-gcp - 5.4.0-1126.135~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1069-ibm - 5.4.0-1069.74~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1121-oracle - 5.4.0-1121.130~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1106-raspi - 5.4.0-1106.118~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
